answers.answer: I'm also overweight and have been told for years that I'd probably have trouble getting pregnant. I had never tried until i met my bf and I got pregnant in less then a year(I know  its a little fast). Anyway, I'm 39 weeks today and have a fairly good pregnancy. I was diagnosed with high blood pressure but with the medicine is under control. I was nervous about being overweight and pregnant mostly about gaining more weight but I haven't gained too much I'm healthy and the babies healthy. I do have a few concerns about labor and delivery but I guess I'll cross that bridge when I get there. Hope all goes well with you.

Thanks. I was overweight with my last pregnancy. But that was ten years and fifty lbs ago.  With her I only gained 7 lbs and lost 12 before leaving hospital. So I was lucky.I have pcos and have had several miscarriages over the years. So I am being VERY careful.

One thing I wish I would have known before having my first child (as an overweight woman) is to avoid csection. The more belly fat we have the higher the risk for infection. My dr knew as soon as she saw me that a csection was going to be a problem for me. Unfortunately I had an emergency one and sure enough a week after being discharged I was back in the hospital with an infection.Try your best to control your salt and sugar intake so that you don't have higher risk of hypertension and diabetes.I notice there isn't a lot of conversation on here about how pregnancy is different for the plus sized ladies but it is.I wish you the best in health and pregnancy.

I started my pregnancy almost 210 pounds and only 5'3".  My doc was concerned and I had to do extra tests and an extra ultrasound, but no complications so far.  I am at 38+3 now, and the only concern right now is that he is about 7.5 pounds and doesn't seem to be ready to come out yet.  I've gained about 24 pounds so far, which this app keeps telling me it's excessive, but my doc is fine with it.  Good luck to you!

question: This is my third pregnancy. I have a 19 & 11 year old. I am considered obese as I am really short and over weight. This pregnancy was a little bit of a surprise. (but a great one!!) I am only 5 weeks along. Stressed because I am getting married in August and I am unemployed searching for a job.Being overweight I am worried about things such as miscarriage, being overly tired etc. not to mention my stomach is so swollen I look 5 months along  :-(Does anyone have any wise words to share?Thank you in advance
